903.question: what dataset statistics are provided?
903.response: {'Answer': 'The provided dataset contains 14,074 answerable questions and 13,246 unanswerable questions, with the distribution of question types including "what/which" (14%), "y/n" (29%), "why" (12%), "who/whose" (12%), "where" (9%), "how" (7%), "when" (6%), "how long/often" (5%), "how many/much" (4%), and other types (2%).'}
903.answer: More than 2,100 texts were paired with 15 questions each, resulting in a total number of approx. 32,000 annotated questions. 13% of the questions are not answerable.  Out of the answerable questions, 10,160 could be answered from the text directly (text-based) and 3,914 questions required the use of commonsense knowledge (script-based).  The final dataset comprises 13,939 questions, 3,827 of which require commonsense knowledge (i.e. 27.4%).

904.question: what dataset statistics are provided?
904.response: {'Answer': 'The dataset contains 14,074 answerable questions, with 10,160 text-based and 3,914 script-based. It also contains 13,246 unanswerable questions, with 9,974 unknown and 3,172 unfitting.'}
